intro: Eriocaulon arupense, commonly known as the Arup sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Eriocaulon arupense is often found in lowland areas with high moisture content.
